Description: Conical hat or food cover made of fibre laid into a cord which is coiled and interwoven with transverse strips; it is brown coloured with patterns of scarlet and straw with green lozenges; the apex has a tuft of crimson and yellow silk and white fibre.
Curator's comments: Slip has a record: "A similar in the British Museum is labelled 'From the desert eastward of the Nile, between Secatti and the borders of Egypt, used by the Bisharas'".
